message.content:
cs.CG, cs.GR, cs.NA, cs.DS, cs.SY

Reasoning: 
1. cs.CG (Computational Geometry) - The paper presents an algorithm for computing topological characteristics of three-dimensional bodies, which is a common problem in computational geometry. 
2. cs.GR (Graphics) - The algorithm can be used for generating and manipulating 3D graphics, which falls under the scope of this sub-category. 
3. cs.NA (Numerical Analysis) - The paper describes a numerical algorithm for computing topological characteristics, which is a core topic in numerical analysis. 
4. cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms) - The algorithm presented in the paper involves a discretization of Morse theory, which is a common technique used in data structures and algorithms. 
5. cs.SY (Systems and Control) - The paper may be relevant to this sub-category as it presents an algorithm for analyzing the topology of three-dimensional bodies, which could have applications in control systems.
